etymologies: late 19th century: from Greek pelux, peluk- ‘bowl’ + sauros ‘lizard’

definitions: a large extinct reptile of the late Carboniferous and Permian periods, typically having a line of long bony spines along the back supporting a sail-like crest.

notes.text: Order Pelycosauria, subclass Synapsida: several families and genera, including Dimetrodon and Edaphosaurus

shortDefinitions: large fossil reptile of late Carboniferous and Permian periods
